title: Debug and Fix Docker Compose Setup for All Services
summary: Docker Compose work restored most API services but the MCP container still lacks a Dockerfile. Base compose commands are back to using uv run, so we need to realign entrypoints and rebuild the MCP image before declaring the stack fixed.

success_criteria.text: All API services (files-api, git-api, rag-api, lock-api, crew-api) start successfully and pass health checks
MCP server starts successfully and is accessible
All services use correct virtual environment paths
Docker Compose configuration is properly documented

acceptance_checks.text: All services respond to health check endpoints
No permission errors in service logs
Virtual environment paths are correctly configured
Docker Compose override file is properly configured

subtasks: Identify and fix Docker build issues with missing directories
Fix virtual environment path issues in Docker containers
Update docker-compose.yml commands to use correct Python paths

Fixed .dockerignore files to allow tasks/ and memory-bank/ directories
Removed unnecessary COPY commands from crew-api Dockerfile

2025-10-02 — Reviewed repository: dockerfiles/mcp missing and base compose commands use uv run; reopening Docker Compose fixes.

decisions: Use .venv/bin/python instead of uv run to avoid permission issues with cache directories
Fix docker-compose.override.yml which was overriding main docker-compose.yml commands
Remove unnecessary COPY commands from Dockerfiles that were causing build failures
Update .dockerignore files to allow required directories for services
lessons_learned: Docker Compose override files can silently override main configuration - always check both files
uv run requires cache directory permissions that may not be available in restricted containers
Using .venv/bin/python directly is more reliable than uv run in containerized environments
Health checks in Docker Compose help identify which services are actually working
Container logs are essential for debugging startup issues
issues_risks: MCP service still failing with exit code 135 - needs investigation
Some services may have dependency issues that aren't immediately visible
Virtual environment paths may break if Dockerfile changes
Override file changes may not be obvious to other developers
MCP image cannot build because dockerfiles/mcp/Dockerfile is missing in the repository.
Need to verify uv run usage does not reintroduce permission issues inside containers.
next_steps: Add a dockerfiles/mcp Dockerfile that installs MCP dependencies inside the image.
Decide on a consistent runtime command strategy (.venv python vs uv run) across compose files.
Run docker compose up --build after fixes to confirm health checks and capture logs.
